newsitem.title: EGYPT: Italian president in Cairo for talks with Mubarak.
newsitem.headline: Italian president in Cairo for talks with Mubarak.

text.p: Italian President Oscar Luigi Scalfaro arrived in Cairo on Friday for talks with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak and other officials on the Middle East peace process.
Scalfaro began his visit to Egypt earlier in the day by visiting the graves of Italian soldiers killed during the battle of el-Alamein, a town near Alexandria on Egypt's Mediterranean coast.
Commonwealth forces led by British General Bernard Montgomery launched a huge offensive against Italian and German forces under German Field Marshal Erwin Rommel on October 23, 1942 at el-Alamein.
Egyptian officials said Scalfaro would meet Mubarak on Saturday morning for talks on the latest developments in the Middle East peace process.
Egypt along with other Arab countries has welcomed a greater role for the European Union in the negotiations between Israel and its Arab neighbours.
Scalfaro is also due to meet members of the Egyptian parliament and Arab League Secretary General Esmat Abdel-Megiud.
Scalfaro is expected to leave Egypt on Saturday evening.
